sentences: Naist võtma - to marry a woman
Ta naist leidis - He found a wife
Noormees abiellus naist vahetades - The young man married by exchanging women
context: The word 'naist' is the partitive singular form of the Estonian noun 'naine', which means 'woman'. In this grammatical case, it can mean either 'a woman' or refer to a wife. The dictionary definitions also show that in some contexts, particularly with verbs like 'võtma' (to take), it relates to marriage concepts - 'naist võtma' means to marry a woman.
